results.title: Australian defence feature
results.creator_credit: Greg Parry and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description: Three magazine-type features that have been put together to make this 24 minute film. The first segment titled ‘Cat and Arrest’ shows the training and the initial landing of Navy Skyhawk pilots on the aircraft carrier HMAS Melbourne. The second ‘On Target’ shows the clearance of potentially explosive ordnance from the Evans Head bombing range under an Air Force program while the third item ‘Rescue 036’ shows the ‘rescue’ of a pilot after a simulated helicopter crash near the Army Aviation Centre at Oakley in Queensland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Parry and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: Australian animals
results.brief_description: Shows a wide variety of Australian animals in their natural habitat, including the spiny anteater, koala, wombat, emu, platypus, lizards, parrots and cockatoos. No narration.

results.title: Australian achievement
results.brief_description: This film showcases the production of McPherson’s “Macson” lathe featuring footage of a production line in a Holden car plant, the launch of a P.J. Adams of London ship, and sections of the power grid. Provides a detailed explanation of lathe production, including footage of the research laboratory undertaking improvement in design right up to the point of the final stage of lathes being packed for export.

results.title: Australia presents world of birds
results.brief_description: Australian birds building their nests and rearing their young. Those shown include the buff-tailed hornbill, the speckled warbler, the rainbow bird, the emu, fairy penguins, black swans, willie wagtails, kookaburra, and lyrebirds.
results.description: Australian birds building their nests and rearing their young. Those shown include the buff-tailed hornbill, the speckled warbler, the rainbow bird, the emu, fairy penguins, black swans, willie wagtails, kookaburra, and lyrebirds.

results.title: Australia daze
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, Graeme Isaac and Fiske/Isaac
results.brief_description: On the 26th January 1988, Australia celebrated its bicentenary in a variety of different ways. This program looks at some of them, from the re-enactment of the arrival of the first fleet in Sydney Harbour, seen through the eyes of wealthy socialites on their motor launch, and more ordinary Australians at their barbecue to scenes of the official speeches and the progress of the Aboriginal “March for Freedom, Justice and Hope” In between we see European immigrants and their celebrations, a street party and the outback cattle ranchers to whom it is just another working day.

results.title: Australia & company unlimited
results.brief_description: A commentary, expressing faith in Australia’s future, illustrated by various scenes from national life - mainly primary and secondary industries. This film was made for the Ford Motor Company of Australia.
